Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp

Class DSNEnvelopeParameters

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.DSNEnvelopeParameters
  • public class DSNEnvelopeParameters
extends java.lang.Object
    DSN envelope parameters from the MAIL FROM command.

    This class holds the DSN-related parameters specified in the MAIL FROM command as defined in RFC 3461:

    • RET - What to return in DSN (FULL or HDRS)
    • ENVID - Envelope identifier for correlation

    Example MAIL FROM with DSN parameters: 

     MAIL FROM:<sender@example.com> RET=HDRS ENVID=QQ314159

    The ENVID is transmitted as xtext (RFC 3461 Section 4) and is automatically decoded when parsed.

    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    DSNReturn, RFC 3461 - SMTP DSN

    • Constructor Detail

      • DSNEnvelopeParameters

        public DSNEnvelopeParameters​(DSNReturn ret,
                             java.lang.String envid)
        Creates new DSN envelope parameters.
        Parameters:
        ret - the return type (FULL or HDRS), may be null
        envid - the envelope ID, may be null

    • Method Detail

      • getRet

        public DSNReturn getRet()
        Returns the RET parameter value.

        This indicates how much of the original message should be included in any DSN that is generated.

        Returns:
        the return type, or null if not specified

      • getEnvid

        public java.lang.String getEnvid()
        Returns the ENVID parameter value.

        This is an opaque identifier assigned by the sender that can be used to correlate DSN responses with the original message.

        Returns:
        the envelope ID, or null if not specified

      • hasParameters

        public boolean hasParameters()
        Returns true if any DSN parameters were specified.
        Returns:
        true if RET or ENVID is set

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
